Medicaid Enforcement: 10 Areas To Watch

Law360, New York (March 19, 2014, 10:39 PM ET) -- The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Office of Inspector General ("HHS-OIG") recently released its fiscal year 2013 annual report on the performance of the Medicaid fraud control units ("MFCU"). This report is a summary of state MFCU efforts, successes and challenges during FY 2013.



The report is a reminder that state Medicaid fraud enforcement is active and that Medicaid compliance must remain an area of focus for providers, suppliers and vendors, specifically including pharmaceutical manufacturers and others in the chain of distribution of prescription...

article_metadata.description: The annual reports from both the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services and Health Care Fraud and Abuse Control program indicate that Medicaid enforcement is on the rise. We believe there are 10 Medicaid compliance areas, such as federal and state moritoria and Stark Law applications, that health providers may wish to focus on, say Judith Waltz and Torrey Young of Foley & Lardner LLP.
